definition: to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon
weight/number/code/to pile/to stack/classifier for length or distance (yard), happenings etc
paragraph/section/segment/stage (of a process)/classifier for stories, periods of time, lengths of thread etc

sentences.english: It also comes jam-packed with premade code snippets for common CSS styles.
sentences.chinese: 它还附带果酱与常见的CSS样式代码段预制包装。

sentences.english: Inserting a snippet should add to the project any references needed.
sentences.chinese: 插入代码段时应在项目中添加所需的任何引用。

sentences.english: If the snippet contains scripting code, the scripts are also sandboxed.
sentences.chinese: 如果该代码段包含脚本代码，则脚本也被沙箱化。

sentences.english: Code fragments from this sample appear throughout this section.
sentences.chinese: 此处将用整节的篇幅来显示该示例中的各个代码段。

sentences.english: The last line of the code snippet saves the session.
sentences.chinese: 上面代码段的最后一行代码将保存会话。

sentences.english: All three kind of parentheses are semantically equivalent and are shown in the snippet below.
sentences.chinese: 三种括号在语义上等价，如下面的代码段所示。

sentences.english: I've structured the example for each model as two separate code fragments.
sentences.chinese: 我已经将每个模型的示例结构化为两个独立的代码段。

sentences.english: The following sections contain code snippets for a few such useful commands.
sentences.chinese: 下面的部分中包含了一些有用的命令的代码段。

sentences.english: Those small sections of code also become easier to maintain.
sentences.chinese: 这些小的代码段也更容易维护。

sentences.english: Fold the data section into the text section.

definition: to pass an argument (computing)/abbr. for 傳遞參數|传递参数[chuan2 di4 can1 shu4]
